sections.title: Catch Negative Thoughts
sections.instruction: Write down specific negative thoughts you've been having about yourself. Be honest and specific.
sections.placeholder: Example: 'I'm terrible at everything I try' or 'Nobody really likes me'

sections.title: Evidence For
sections.instruction: What evidence supports this negative thought? Be specific and factual.
sections.subheading: List evidence that supports this thought
sections.placeholder: List specific examples or situations that seem to support this thought...

sections.title: Evidence Against
sections.instruction: What evidence contradicts this negative thought? Include times when the opposite was true.
sections.subheading: List evidence that contradicts this thought
sections.placeholder: List examples of times when this thought wasn't true, accomplishments, positive feedback...

sections.title: Friend's Perspective
sections.instruction: What would you say to a good friend who had this same negative thought about themselves?
sections.subheading: What would you tell a friend in this situation?
sections.placeholder: Write the compassionate, supportive response you'd give to a friend...

sections.title: Balanced Thought
sections.instruction: Based on the evidence and your friend's perspective, write a more balanced, compassionate thought.
sections.placeholder: Example: 'I'm learning and growing. Sometimes I struggle, but I also have successes and people who care about me.'
